description.narrative: Stöd till Nordiska Afrikainstitutet för forskning om bistånd. Grundtanken med projektet är att främja forskning av direkt betydelse för politik/policy och utvecklingssamarbete. Projektet strävar efter att överbrygga gapet mellan forskning och politik/policy, exempelvis genom att undersöka hur beslutsfattare kan involveras i forskningsprocessen, vilket skulle främja ett ömsesidigt lärande.

Support to the Nordic Africa Institute. A basic idea with the project is to promote research of direct relevance for policy and aid interventions. In addition, the project attempts to bridge research and policy, for example by exploring means to involve policy makers in the research process, thus promoting a mutual learning experience throughout the process.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: This pilot project "Nordic Africa Institute Research on Development Aid 2013 - 2014" (with a no cost extension agreement to 30 October 2015) was Sida funded with one disbursement of SEK 4 120 000. The aim of the project was to increase learning in Nordic, and specifically Swedish, development cooperation with regards to the role of external actors in institutional change and development of Africa. The basic idea with the project is to promote research of direct relevance for policy and aid interventions, carried out through research coordination, conducting research and dissemination, organizing seminars and policy briefings.
Based on the objectives of this pilot project, four components were set out and all depart from the theme of aid and institutional development in Africa: 1. Coordinating research on Africa of particular relevance to development actors; 2. Synthesizing and disseminating research fundings on topics of particular relevance to policy makers on African development and institutional change; 3. Conducting research on aspects of African developemnt and institutional change of direct relevance to policy making and development assistance; 4. Recurring seminar on institutional change with renowned international scholars and representatives of the Nordic policy makers.
To carried out these missions, NAI relied on the participation of and dialogues with policy-makers, especially staff at Sida's different departments and secondments.
Overall, NAI have managed to reach the results as intented with regards to increased understanding and debates on research topics that are relevant for policy making on African development and institutional change. Focus remained on informing the Swedish policy-makers, through dialogues and research communication.
The overall theme of the research is institutional change and that embraces a number of research topics. These research topics are relevant and in-line with the stated outcomes. However, all research conducted in this project have not been published and most will become NAI's reports without external publications. It is difficult to assess the results of high quality research and its outreach to a broader audiences outside Sida, MoFA and NAi's own spheres.
As intended outcomes, the results show that NAI has produced research relevant to development policy makers within the research topics. NAI has also made efforts to synthesize and disseminate research findings to development actors in Sweden on African development and institutional change thorough small-scale seminars and conference support.
